If you’re updating devices that are already running Windows 11, version 22H2,
you can use an enablement package
 for
a fast, easy installation process.

Windows 11 23H2 Enablement Package Location 
https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/windows-it-pro-blog/what-s-new-for-it-pros-in-windows-11-version-23h2/ba-p/3967814
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftechcommunity.microsoft.com%2Ft5%2Fwindows-it-pro-blog%2Fwhat-s-new-for-it-pros-in-windows-11-version-23h2%2Fba-p%2F3967814&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Cbb92929a929d4236becf08dbdb0c5937%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638344618310742460%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=gEw%2Bk71YhOKlEZxb0hczUpFD4L%2BrXRfNM%2BkFFclr348%3D&reserved=0] 
If you’re updating devices that are already running Windows 11, version 22H2,
you can use an enablement package
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Faka.ms%2Fekb-w11-23H2&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Cbb92929a929d4236becf08dbdb0c5937%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638344618310742460%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=MFcQ7eZBWnSH0obmF56fAzpzqfQPVbyxDh3NCkXvcgk%3D&reserved=0] for
a fast, easy installation process.
